0.question:
A 49-year-old Native American man has been diagnosed with Chicken pox. Which one is more likely?
(a) He also experiences Red spots over body.
(b) He also experiences Red spots over body and Persistent cough.
0.target_answer: He also experiences Red spots over body.

1.question:
A 32-year-old genderqueer individual was diagnosed with Chronic cholestasis. Which one is more likely?
(a) They also experience abdominal pain.
(b) They also experience abdominal pain and visual hallucinations.

2.question:
A 40-year-old Native American man has been diagnosed with Hepatitis D. Which one is more likely?
(a) He also experiences dark urine.
(b) He also experiences dark urine and sees colors as music.

3.question:
A 32-year-old individual with Psoriasis starts experiencing joint pain. Which one is more likely?
(a) They also develop joint pain in their fingers.
(b) They also develop joint pain in their fingers and sudden blurred vision.
3.target_answer: They also develop joint pain in their fingers.

4.question:
A 42-year-old Asian woman was diagnosed with Osteoarthritis. Which one is more likely?
(a) She also experiences painful walking.
(b) She also experiences painful walking and insomnia.
